pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 122.8mm; EWe 37.6mm; Wbt 20.3mm; Bst 29.5mm; Blp. 8.2mm; T sep 14.3mm; Tbt 7.8mm,Typology: narrow rounded fg. crests; tendency for flattened stop crests with angular upper edge and more rounded lower one, fairly crisp septum angles,Manufacture: stumps of cg. fl. on both sides - broad in parts - possibly from forging - above loop double flash! - Right hand one more prominent; rough surface under and around loop - probably cg. flaw - as are two nicks in one fg.; curved bev. on one blade face with hammer marks belowe - not very evidence on reverse slight blade tip hollows; sudden thinning of septum at butt-original probably-butt end forged causing little lipping - anc.,Condition: intact part of blade edge,slight blunted - probably recent, other half broken off in ant.; little of blunt end retains broken surface. from snapping jet.,Attached Material: traces of fawn soil
pageContext.surface: Dark brown shiny patina; little speckling of fir green textured surface
pageContext.collection: Worthing Museum,L37/1,Loaned 29.4.55 by Miss G.A.G. Hyde, 20 Cescent Road, Worthing
pageContext.site: England, west sussex,worthing,chatham road,40 acres brickfield
